results.title: Culture and costumes: the great clothes put on
results.creator_credit: Randolph Hobler, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents clothing as a phenomenon unique to humans in the animal kingdom. The functional aspect has led to innovation in fashion in many cultures and throughout history.

results.title: Laxton
results.creator_credit: AVC Productions and University of Hull
results.brief_description: The story of Laxton, a village in Nottinghamshire, and its evolution from Norman times, showing how strip farming operated. Shows how a medieval management system fits into the modern agricultural scene. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.description: The story of Laxton, a village in Nottinghamshire, and its evolution from Norman times, showing how strip farming operated. Shows how a medieval management system fits into the modern agricultural scene. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Arab-Israeli conflict
results.brief_description: An impartial analysis of the political and teeritorial problems of the Israelis and the Arabs with the differences being traced back to Abraham. Key areas in the disputes are indicated with maps. No other credits available. Suitable for Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Picnic with Weismann = Picknick mit Weismann
results.creator_credit: Jan Svankmajer, A H Puluj and ACI Films
results.brief_description: An unusual, surrealistic recounting of a day’s outing. Inanimate objects (a man’s suit, a trowel, charis, an old gramophone) take on a life of their own. A wardrobe opens and a man, bound and gagged falls into a prepared grave.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Svankmajer, A H Puluj and ACI Films

results.title: Masuo Ikeda: printmaker
results.brief_description: A modern Japanese artist living in New York creates a colour print from a copper plate as he explains his sources of inspiration and techniques. His work is shown form making the plates through to pulling the final prints.

results.title: Flyaway
results.brief_description: Contrasts the earthbound obstacle ridden path of a man with the free-flowing glide of a plane. A spectrum of animals is used to represent the earthbound, the semi-bound and the free. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: Sneetches
results.creator_credit: Hawley Pratt, Isadore Freleng, Ted Geisel and CBS
results.brief_description: Animated version of the Dr Seuss story from “Dr Seuss on the Loose”. This film implies that differences are only relative and in essence don’t matter. Suitable for upper primary level.
